intro: Psychotria acunae, commonly known as the "Amazonian psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, black berries that are edible but have a mild, sometimes bitter taste. Psychotria acunae is often found in shaded, humid environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
